intro: Corydalis parnassica, commonly known as the Parnassian Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces slender, erect stems that often grow in rocky or alpine environments. It is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms. Corydalis parnassica is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
